meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sturdy.
meanings.sent1: The sturdinesses of the old bridge impressed the engineers.
meanings.sent2: The sturdinesses of the table made it perfect for heavy use.
meanings.sent3: The sturdinesses of the toy castle made it survive many epic battles.
meanings.sent4: The sturdinesses of the ancient tree roots held the soil together like a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The sturdinesses of the mountain stood firm against the raging storm.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: She admired the sturdinesses of the steel beams in the building.
meanings.sent2: The sturdinesses of the armor protected the knight in battle.
meanings.sent3: The sturdinesses of the umbrella saved her from getting wet in the sudden downpour.
meanings.sent4: The sturdinesses of the dam held back the powerful river waters.
meanings.sent5: The sturdinesses of the rope prevented the climber from falling.

meanings.definition: The strength and durability of an object.
meanings.sent1: The sturdinesses of the car's frame ensured safety in a crash.
meanings.sent2: The sturdinesses of the house withstood the strong winds of the storm.
meanings.sent3: The sturdinesses of the backpack made it survive the rough hiking trail.
meanings.sent4: The sturdinesses of the ship's hull kept it afloat in rough seas.
meanings.sent5: The sturdinesses of the lock protected the valuable contents inside.
